feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 13 at 11:25AM AKST until February 14 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 6 AM Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 6:20AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Storm Total Snowfall 3 To 5 Inches Through Tonight... Snow will continue into tonight across the Interior. An additional 1 to 3 inches of snow is expected across the Interior through tonight, for a storm total of 3 to 5 inches. Snow is expected to taper off late tonight. entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow occuring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:19AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Brief Return to Winter Monday Night into Tuesday Morning... After another dry and warm day today, a fast moving slider-type low pressure system and cold front will move quickly across eastern California and the Great Basin late Monday into Tuesday. This will bring an increase in winds Monday afternoon, and colder conditions with a short period of rain and snow Monday evening
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...A Brief Return to Winter Monday Night into Tuesday Morning...
